sentences: Kemiallinen koostumukseltaan t채m채 aine on monimutkainen.
context: The Finnish word 'aine' has multiple meanings depending on context. It can refer to physical substances or materials, such as chemicals or compounds. In educational contexts, it means 'subject' like a field of study. As a singular noun, it refers to one substance/material/subject. When used in compound words, it often appears in the partitive form 'ainetta', indicating an unspecified amount of something.
